name: WindowsTaskScheduler
description: Create and maintain scheduled tasks on Windows servers.
author: Peter Barendse
helpMarkDown: This extension can create and alter Windows scheduled tasks, using WinRM.

inputs.name: Servers
inputs.label: Server(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the server names. Multiple entries should be comma seperated (server.domain.loc).

inputs.name: ServerUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: User needs local administrator permissions (domain\user)

inputs.name: UseSSL
inputs.label: Use HTTPS
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use HTTP or HTTPS for the WinRM connection with the machine(s).

inputs.name: CheckCA
inputs.label: Skip CA check
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to skip validating the authenticity of the machine's certificate from a trusted certification authority. The parameter is required for the WinRM HTTPS protocol.

inputs.name: Method
inputs.label: Deploy method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the task once, daily or on selected days.

inputs.name: TaskName
inputs.label: Task Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide as taskname. Folders are supported. Either enter just the taskname, or folder\taskname.

inputs.name: TaskNameforXML
inputs.label: Task Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide as taskname. Folders are supported. Either enter just the taskname, or folder\taskname.
This step is optional. The taskname and folder can be supplied within the XML. (Task.RegistrationInfo.URI)

inputs.name: TaskDescription
inputs.label: Task Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: Task description

inputs.name: TaskActions
inputs.label: Task Actions
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Define the actions. Several can be made. One line per Action. Arguments per action must be placed around square brackets:

Eg: "C:\folder name\example.exe" [-Arg1 value1 -Arg2 value2]

inputs.name: XMLFile
inputs.label: XML file location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where XML file exist.

inputs.name: TaskEnabled
inputs.label: Enable task
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable or disable the task upon creation or update.

inputs.name: Schedule
inputs.label: Run Schedule
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run the task once, daily or on selected days.

inputs.name: TriggerDays
inputs.label: Running days
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define on which days the task runs.

inputs.name: TriggerTime
inputs.label: Start time
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define which time the task starts. HH:MM

inputs.name: RemoveScheduledTask
inputs.label: Delete task after completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Delete the task upon completion.

inputs.name: TriggerTimeout
inputs.label: Delete timeout (in sec)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The task can only be deleted when it's not running. Define in seconds how long must be waited, before a timeout on the running task is given.

inputs.name: RunAsUser
inputs.label: Run task as
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Username to run the task,

Eg: dev\svc00001 or NT Authority\SYSTEM.

inputs.name: RunAsPassword
inputs.label: Task password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password for the matching username. If you keep this field blank, the task will only run if the task user is logged in on the target machine. The field needs to be blank if the user is an NT Authority such as LOCAL SERVICE or SYSTEM.

inputs.name: AdvancedSettings
inputs.label: Set Repetition and Interval settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: Repetition and Interval settings

inputs.name: TriggerRepetitionInterval
inputs.label: Repeat task every:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Repeat task at an interval. Values can be edited. Please use the format <number> <TimeNotation>. Eg. 3 Hours or 7 minutes. Minutes and hours are supported

inputs.name: TriggerRepetitionDuration
inputs.label: for a duration of:
inputs.helpMarkDown: The duration can only be equal or greater then the interval. Values can be edited. Please use the format <number> <TimeNotation>. Eg. 3 Hours or 7 minutes. Minutes, hours and days are supported
